title: Big Buck Bunny 480p (x264, he-aac)
description:
This is an encode from the original png sources of the Peach open movie Big Buck Bunny (http://www.bigbuckbunny.org)

I made this because the formats they offer it in are not very good. I thought I could do much better. This is the 480 encode. Here are a few of the problems I have:

1) Their MP4 is using MPEG4 ASP (FFMPEG4), which is not all that efficient of a codec. Especially with HD content. And, AVI...use a modern container!!
2) Their h.264 encodes use the QuickTime encoder, which is a very very poor implementation of h.264.
3) Theora isn&#039;t the greatest codec, but at least it&#039;s open. But, stereo vorbis, why?
4) MSMPEG4, why???????

So let me present my encode:
Container: Matroska
Video Codec: x264
Video Bitrate: 1509kbps
Audio Codec: Nero HE-AAC
Audio Bitrate: 221kbps

For the curious, here&#039;s what settings I used:
Video was scaled from the 1080p source using the Bicubic Natural Spline scaler in libswscale. I used x264 r869 with the psyrdo patch applied.
--keyint 240 --min-keyint 24 --pre-scenecut --bframes 16 --b-pyramid --ref 16 --crf 18 --partitions all --direct auto --weightb --me umh --subme 7 --b-rdo --mixed-refs --bime --8x8dct --trellis 2

For audio, I used the latest release of the Nero AAC Codec (version 1.1.34.2) at -q 0.25

My results, a file sized less than their lowest quality, but with much better visual quality, and full 5.1 channel surround. Enjoy!
